info.title: Elements Supply API
info.summary: Canonical contract for the Elements Supply public API.
info.description:
Elements Supply is a multi-tenant sourcing and procurement platform that exposes a single
public API for authenticated buyers, suppliers, and platform administrators. All responses
are wrapped in the standard envelope documented in `/docs/API_ENVELOPE.md` and conform to
the schemas defined in this spec. Unless noted otherwise, every path requires either a
bearer token (Sanctum personal access token) or an API key issued by the platform admin
console.

apiKeyAuth.name: X-API-Key
apiKeyAuth.description:
API keys are issued and rotated in the platform admin console. Include the value in the
`X-API-Key` header to authenticate machine-to-machine integrations.

bearerAuth.description:
Supply a bearer token acquired via Sanctum. All tokens are scoped to a specific
company tenant and inherit the permissions assigned to the issuing user.

AcceptLanguage.name: Accept-Language
AcceptLanguage.description: Overrides language resolution when localization features are enabled.

XRequestId.name: X-Request-Id
XRequestId.description: Correlates requests across services. Echoed back on every response when supplied.

XRateLimitLimit.description: Maximum number of requests allowed in the current window.

XRateLimitRemaining.description: Remaining requests available in the current window.

XRateLimitReset.description: Seconds until the current rate limit window resets.

XRequestId.description: Unique identifier for the current request.

XTraceId.description: Internal trace identifier for support escalations.

token_prefix.description: First six characters of the secret for display.

remember.description: When true the session cookie is kept beyond the current browser session.

token.description: Token issued via the password reset email.
Session identifier echoed in the `XSRF-TOKEN` cookie for SPA clients.

feature_flags.description: Flattened feature flag map for the authenticated company.

plan.description: Active plan code assigned to the company, if any.
Plan code applied to the company.

role.description: Role assigned to the user (buyer_admin, supplier_user, etc.).

token.description: Personal access token value. Store securely.

reason.description: Buyer-provided rationale for closing the RFQ.

closed_at.description: Overrides the default (now) close timestamp if the backend permits backdating.

status.description: Buyer account status (pending, active, suspended, archived).

awarded_qty.description: Optional awarded quantity for partial allocations.

DashboardMetrics.description: Aggregated counts shown on the operations dashboard.

entity.description: Target entity slug to associate with the uploaded document.

visibility.description: Visibility must match the configured `documents.allowed_visibilities` list (private, company, public).

errors.description: Field-level validation errors keyed by attribute.

expires_at.description: Timestamp when the export artifact is purged from storage. Clients must requeue after expiry.

timezone.description: IANA timezone identifier applied to tenant data.

locale.description: BCP‑47 locale for formatting dates and numerics.

Money.description: Monetary amount expressed in minor units. `amount` is derived from `amount_minor` and `currency` using the company rounding rules.

amount.description: Derived major-unit representation. Submitters may omit; backend recalculates using company precision.

page.description: Alias provided for SDK ergonomics. Mirrors `current_page`.

message.description: Optional note sent with publish notifications.

RequestMeta.description: Metadata applied to every successful response. Includes request correlation identifiers and pagination cursors.

RfqAttachment.description: Document attached to an RFQ per the documents deep spec.

document_id.description: Identifier of the underlying Document resource.

uploaded_by.description: Condensed user summary for audit surfaces.

cad_document_id.description: Reference to an uploaded CAD document.

event.description: Machine-readable event identifier (e.g., created, published, invitation_sent).

type.description: Result type identifier (rfq, quote, supplier, purchase_order, etc.).

company_domain.description: Public email domain used for verification.

SuccessEnvelope.description: Wrapper for all successful responses. `meta.request_id` always echoes the inbound `X-Request-Id` or an internally generated UUID.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp in the tenant's configured timezone.

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp in the tenant's configured timezone.

deleted_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp in the tenant's configured timezone.

ServerError.description: Unexpected server error. Contact support with the supplied request identifier.

TooManyRequests.description: Rate limit exceeded for the current identity.

item_name: The item name field is required.

200.description: Paginated API keys filtered by company when provided.

201.description: API key created. Plaintext secret returned once.

token.description: Plaintext API key value. Display once.

201.description: API key secret rotated. Returns new token.

post.description: Sends a password reset link email if the account exists. The response is identical whether or not the email belongs to an account.

200.description: Reset email dispatched (or suppressed for privacy).

post.description: Authenticates a user with email and password credentials and returns the enriched session payload used by Inertia and the SDK.

get.description: Returns the authenticated user, company context, feature flags, and active plan code associated with the current session.

post.summary: Self-register a buyer company and primary owner
post.description: Creates a user + company record, uploads supporting documents, and returns an authenticated session payload for immediate onboarding.

200.description: Registration succeeded and the caller is authenticated.

409.description: Attempted to register while already authenticated.

post.description: Verifies the password reset token issued via email and sets a new password for the user.

422.description: Invalid reset token or password payload.
